intro: Doellingeria humilis, commonly known as the dwarf swamp milkweed, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink to reddish in color. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in bogs and marshes. Doellingeria humilis plays an important role in supporting local pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
